Programs on a2n-s' Personal Website & Blog <<<<<<< Updated upstream <<<<<<< Updated upstream https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/ Recent content in Programs on a2n-s' Personal Website & Blog Hugo -- gohugo.io en-us Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 Alacritty terminal emulator. https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/alacritty/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/alacritty/ ======= ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/ Recent content in Programs on a2n-s' Personal Website & Blog Hugo -- gohugo.io en-us Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 Alacritty terminal emulator. https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/alacritty/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/alacritty/ <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes Alacritty is a minimal terminal emulator. Some resources. the github page here. the arch wiki page here. Dependencies for alacritty. xterm-256color mode to display many colors.u the mononoki nerd font: can be installed with yay -S nerd-fonts-mononoki Install alacritty manually. install the dependencies. install the alacritty command. copy alacritty.yml inside your ~/.config/alacritty directory. Gallery. Available soon.

Alacritty is a minimal terminal emulator.

Some resources.

  • the github page here.
  • the arch wiki page here.

Dependencies for alacritty.

  • xterm-256color mode to display many colors.u
  • the mononoki nerd font: can be installed with yay -S nerd-fonts-mononoki

Install alacritty manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the alacritty command.
  • copy alacritty.yml inside your ~/.config/alacritty directory.

Gallery.

Available soon.

bash shell environment. <<<<<<< Updated upstream <<<<<<< Updated upstream https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/bash/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/bash/ ======= ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/bash/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/bash/ <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes “Bash is a Unix shell and command language written by Brian Fox for the GNU Project as a free software replacement for the Bourne shell.” Some resources. the wikipedia page here. an extensive tutorial to use bash here. Dependencies for the bash shell. the scripts in the scripts directory. neofetch, git and cal. Install the bash shell environment manually. install the dependencies. copy .

“Bash is a Unix shell and command language written by Brian Fox for the GNU Project as a free software replacement for the Bourne shell.”

Some resources.

  • the wikipedia page here.
  • an extensive tutorial to use bash here.

Dependencies for the bash shell.

  • the scripts in the scripts directory.
  • neofetch, git and cal.

Install the bash shell environment manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • copy .bash_aliases, .bash_logout, .bash_profile, .bashrc and .profile inside your ~/ directory.

Gallery.

Available soon.

git <<<<<<< Updated upstream <<<<<<< Updated upstream https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/git/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/git/ ======= ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/git/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/git/ <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes “Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.” Some resources. the official page here. the arch wiki page here. an interactive and visual tutorial to learn git here. Install git manually. install the git command. copy .gitconfig inside your ~/ directory. Gallery. Available soon.

“Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.”

a wallpaper manager.

Some resources.

  • the arch wiki page here.
  • a youtube tutorial here.

Dependencies for nitrogen.

  • some wallpapers to load and restore.
  • mine currently is a vibrant scene.

Install nitrogen manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the nitrogen command.
  • copy nitrogen.cfg inside your ~/.config/nitrogen directory.

spectrWM <<<<<<< Updated upstream <<<<<<< Updated upstream https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/spectrwm/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/spectrwm/ ======= ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/spectrwm/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/spectrwm/ <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes “spectrwm is a small, dynamic tiling and reparenting window manager for X11.” Some resources. the github page here. the arch wiki page here. the arch manual page here. Dependencies for spectrWM. the mononoki nerd font. a spectrWM-baraction.sh file. a browser: firefox a menu: dmenu a terminal: alacritty an email application: thunderbird a rendering service: arandr an image editor: gimp. I also use kolourpaint brightnessctl to control the brightness of the main screen.

“spectrwm is a small, dynamic tiling and reparenting window manager for X11.”

Some resources.

  • the github page here.
  • the arch wiki page here.
  • the arch manual page here.

Dependencies for spectrWM.

  • the mononoki nerd font.
  • a spectrWM-baraction.sh file.
  • a browser: firefox
  • a menu: dmenu
  • a terminal: alacritty
  • an email application: thunderbird
  • a rendering service: arandr
  • an image editor: gimp. I also use kolourpaint
  • brightnessctl to control the brightness of the main screen.
  • amixer to control the volume of the main screen.
  • togkb.sh to switch the keyboard layout.
  • xscreensaver to lock and save the screen usage.

Install spectrwm manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the spectrwm command.
  • copy spectrwm.conf and spectrwm_us.conf inside your ~/.config/spectrwm directory.

Gallery.

Available soon.

vim <<<<<<< Updated upstream <<<<<<< Updated upstream https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/vim/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/vim/ ======= ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/vim/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/vim/ <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes “Vim (/vɪm/; a contraction of Vi IMproved) is a free and open-source, screen-based text editor program for Unix.” Some resources. the wikipedia page here. the arch wiki page here. for the hardcore vimmers among you, check here. an introduction to configuring vim here. adding python IDE features to vim here. Dependencies for vim. make sure to either run vim once with the .vimrc file installed or issue mkdir -p ~/.

“Vim (/vɪm/; a contraction of Vi IMproved) is a free and open-source, screen-based text editor program for Unix.”

Some resources.

  • the wikipedia page here.
  • the arch wiki page here.
  • for the hardcore vimmers among you, check here.
  • an introduction to configuring vim here.
  • adding python IDE features to vim here.

Dependencies for vim.

  • make sure to either run vim once with the .vimrc file installed or issue mkdir -p ~/.vim ~/.vim/autoload ~/.vim/backup ~/.vim/color ~/.vim/plugged.
  • a plugin manager: I use vim-plug which can be installed with curl -fLo ~/.vim/autoload/plug.vim --create-dirs https://raw.githubusercontent.com/junegunn/vim-plug/master/plug.vim
  • the molokai colorscheme -> can be installed with cd ~/.vim/colors; curl -o molokai.vim https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tomasr/molokai/master/colors/molokai.vim.

Install vim.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the vim command.
  • copy .vimrc inside your ~/ directory.

Gallery.

Available soon.

x <<<<<<< Updated upstream <<<<<<< Updated upstream https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/x/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/graphic.github.io/config/doc/programs/x/ ======= ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/x/ Sun, 12 Sep 2021 22:08:05 +0200 https://a2n-s.github.io/config/doc/programs/x/ <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes “The X.Org Server runs on many free-software Unix-like operating systems, including being adopted for use by most Linux distributions and BSD variants.” Some resources. the wikipedia page here. the arch wiki page here. Dependencies for x. picom: a compositor for X11 nitrogen to load and restore wallpapers. xscreensaver to save and lock the screen. spectrWM: the window manager. Install x manually. install the dependencies.

“The X.Org Server runs on many free-software Unix-like operating systems, including being adopted for use by most Linux distributions and BSD variants.”

Some resources.

  • the wikipedia page here.
  • the arch wiki page here.

Dependencies for x.

  • picom: a compositor for X11
  • nitrogen to load and restore wallpapers.
  • xscreensaver to save and lock the screen.
  • spectrWM: the window manager.

Install x manually.

  • install the dependencies.
  • install the x package.
  • copy .xinitrc inside your ~/ directory.

Gallery.
